question.text:
Given below are two statements: one is labelled as Assertion (A) and the other is labelled as Reason (R).

Assertion (A): Amniocentesis for sex determination is one of the strategies of Reproductive and Child Health Care Programme.

Reason (R): Ban on amniocentesis checks increasing menace of female foeticide.

In the light of the above statements, choose the correct answer from the options given below:

options.text: A is false but R is true.
Both A and R are true and R is the correct explanation of A.
Both A and R are true and R is NOT the correct explanation of A.
A is true but R is false.

solution.text:
Amniocentesis:

  • It is a medical procedure used primarily in the prenatal diagnosis of genetic conditions.
  • Genetic disorders like Down's syndrome (21st trisomy) etc. can be detected in this technique.
  • There is a statutory ban on amniocentesis for sex-determination to legally check increasing menace of female foeticides. 
  • Amniocentesis is not a sex determination technique in our country and is not a strategy of RCH.
